the same to me," he said. "I only want to see whether you will let me win this ten, or beat it." 
D61okhov began to deal seriously. Oh, how Rost6v detested at that moment those hands with their short reddish fingers and hairy wrists, which held him in their power. . . . The ten fell to him. 
"You owe forty-three thousand, Count," said D61okhov, and stretching himself he rose from the table. "One does get tired sitting so long," he added. 
"Yes, I'm tired too," said Rost6v.
